item.title: Extending Gotests for Strict Error Tests
item.description: Strict Error Tests in Java I love confirming the stability of my code through writing tests and practicing Test-driven development (TDD). For Java, JUnit was my preferred testing framework of choice. When writing tests to confirm an exception had been thrown, I used the optional parameter expected for the annotation @Test, however I quickly found that this solution would not work for methods where I raised the same exception class multiple times for different error messages, and testing on those messages.
